did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: The Community Service Center (CSC) was established in 1990 to promote community service on campus and to coordinate activities between campus service groups and similar organizations in Durham, NC.

The collection contains newsletters and other mailings, flyers, clippings, printed email, and other materials documenting the activities of the center. The newsletters include information on events, volunteer opportunities, relevant courses, on and off-campus service organizations and related topics.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Community Service Center Records, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Community Service Center Records were received by the University Archives as a transfer in 2000.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Descriptive sources and standards used to create this inventory: DACS, EAD, NCEAD guidelines, and our local Style Guide.
This finding aid is NCEAD compliant.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Community Service Center (CSC) was established in 1990 to promote community service on campus and to coordinate activities between campus service groups and similar organizations in Durham, NC. It is administered through the Division of Student Affairs and is run by an appointed Director and students.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The collection contains newsletters and other mailings, flyers, clippings, printed email, and other materials documenting the activities of the center. The newsletters include information on events, volunteer opportunities, relevant courses, on and off-campus service organizations and related topics. Materials in the collection range in date from 1990-2002.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.
